section.title: Overview
section.para: The Data Maintenance > Counterparties function on the Middle-Office menu from the home page, maintains a list of companies that your company deals with. For example, when creating an Import LC request, a user at your company fills in the beneficiary field by selecting a company from this list. These companies are called counterparties.
This function is documented in the Data Maintenance chapter.

When the Collaboration Suite is enabled (using the usual permissions system), this function has an extra feature - when you add a counterparty to the list, you can add that counterparty to your system as a client, with limited access to facilities. This enables the counterparty's staff to view task lists in order to see tasks assigned to their company.
For this purpose, the input form displayed by this function has some extra fields. These are described here.

para.guilabel: Open an access to the counterparty

entry.para: Place a check mark here to have the counterparty added to as a client company, with limited access to features.
By default, check mark is absent.

para.guilabel: Notify the counterparty after the bank's validation

entry.para: Only available if the above check box has a check mark.
Place a check mark here to enable the counterparty to receive notification of products acknowledged by the bank.
By default, check mark is absent.
If this checkbox is checked, a new section appears where the client is able to indicate through checkboxes which products the counterparty will be notified.
Only available if the above check box has a check mark.
Set of check boxes, one for each product type. Place check marks to show which products the counterparty is to be notified of.
By default, check marks are absent.

section.para: When you click Save on the form, a page appears displaying the login credentials that users at the counterparty should use to connect to :

listitem.para: user name - always set to GUEST
password - set to a random number; when a user at the counterparty first logs in, he or she will change this password
company name - set to the abbreviated name of the counterparty, concatenated with an incremental number to make the name unique

section.para: You must communicate these credentials to the counterparty, by any means you consider appropriate.
